wiki_links.wiki:
You can find the wiki of LuckPerms here:
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki>
wiki_links.install:
You can install LuckPerms on Spigot (including forks like PaperSpigot), Sponge, BungeeCord (Also including common forks), Velocity and others!
Read the installation-page on the wiki for more info:
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Installation>
wiki_links.bungee:
You have to download and install LuckPermsBungee on your BungeeCord to manage BungeeCord permissions.
LuckPermsBungee does **not** manage permissions on Spigot!
Read this page for more info:
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Network-Installation>
wiki_links.sync:
To sync data between servers, you need to connect each LuckPerms to the same database (example: MySQL) and setup a messaging service (By default `sql`)
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Syncing-data-between-servers>
wiki_links.usage:
Here's a page, that helps you to understand and use LuckPerms!
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Usage>
wiki_links.errors:
This page contains common errors of Storage-Systems.
Yours might be listed there too.
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Storage-system-errors>
wiki_links.editor:
LuckPerms offers a easy to use, powerful Web editor, to add, delete and change permissions of groups and playets.
More info can be found here:
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Web-Editor>
wiki_links.verbose:
LuckPerms provides a verbose-command, to find out, what command/function uses what permission.
More info can be found here:
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Verbose>
wiki_links.meta:
You can set prefixes, suffixes and other meta in LuckPerms for players and groups.
Note that LuckPerms does **not** manage chat. You need to use another plugin to show prefixes/suffixes in chat!
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Prefixes,-Suffixes-&-Meta>
wiki_links.context:
You can set a permission or apply a group on a per-world/per-server basis, through so called "contexts".
More info can be found here:
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Context>
wiki_links.default:
LuckPerms already provides a group, that every player gets on join.
This group is called `default`.
You can use multiple methods to change, what group is the default one, or how the default one is presented.
<https://github.com/lucko/LuckPerms/wiki/Default-Groups>
